bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: ① Etiological Agent. Pathological Mechanism identical with yu xue 瘀血① , stagnant blood. Nan jing 難經 22: 血壅而不濡 者，為血後病也 , “When the blood is obstructed [in its movement] and fails to moisten [the body], then the blood was affected by this disease later on”.

② Pathological Condition of rashes and itching accompanied by pain, a condition which, if not cured immediately, will result in suppuration. Chuan xin shi yong fang Recipe book. Southern Song era, 1180. 傳信適用方 quoting Zhi qi ji fang 治奇疾方 writes xue zhu 血住 , blood stoppage. Shi yi de xiao fang 世醫得效方 writes xue yong 血臃 , blood grossness. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 has xue yong 血壅 , “ blood obstruction ”.
